issue.title: Need support for Node.js 20

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: The issue has just been created and it has not been reviewed by the team.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: A request for new functionality or an enhancement to an existing one.

issue.body:
Node.js 20 will be designated as the active LTS version as of October 24, 2023. 
The SDK has a dependency on `@azure/msal-node`, which appears to be outdated. Running the `npm install` commandresults in warnings due to its incompatibility with Node.js 20.

comment.body: @ramfattah Any news to support the current nodejs LTS

payload.description: Welcome to the Bot Framework SDK for JavaScript repository, which is the home for the libraries and packages that enable developers to build sophisticated bot applications using JavaScript.

release.name: Bot Framework JS SDK 4.21.0
release.body:
This is the October 2023 of the JS SDK.  This release contains new Teams features and security fixes.

## What's Changed

### Teams
* port: [#4530] Add support for meeting participants added/removed events by @ceciliaavila in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4538
* port: [#4527][#6655] Implementation of Teams batch APIs by @ceciliaavila in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4535

### Other Changes
* fix: [#2782] Migrate to MSAL from adal-node by @sw-joelmut in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4548
* fix: [#2782] Migrate to MSAL from adal-node - Add MSAL support by @ceciliaavila in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4543
* fix: use connectorClientOptions to create ConnectorFactory (#4420) by @k44 in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4421
* chore: bump get-func-name from 2.0.0 to 2.0.2 by @dependabot in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4540
* fix: fix the exchange token interface prarameter by @wenytang-ms in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4536
* chore: bump postcss from 8.3.5 to 8.4.31 by @dependabot in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4541
* chore: bump @babel/traverse from 7.12.1 to 7.23.2 by @dependabot in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4546
* chore(deps): bump @babel/traverse from 7.12.1 to 7.23.2 in /testing/browser-functional/browser-echo-bot by @dependabot in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4547
* feat: [#4349] Add new method to expose same functionality as BotFrameworkAdapter.processActivityDirect by @erquirogasw in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4380

## New Contributors
* @wenytang-ms made their first contribution in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4536
* @k44 made their first contribution in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/pull/4421

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/compare/4.20.1...4.21.0
release.short_description_html:
This is the October 2023 of the JS SDK. This release contains new Teams features and security fixes.

What's Changed

Teams

  • port: [#4530] Add support for meeting participants added/removed events by @…

issue.title: Extensibility for Teams AI - ability to add to User Agent for Teams AI telemetry

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: The issue has just been created and it has not been reviewed by the team.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: A request for new functionality or an enhancement to an existing one.

issue.body:
Request is from https://github.com/microsoft/teams-ai team

[connectorFactoryImpl](https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/blob/593cd3b86d9b5058cebfd552c2db1953e066291b/libraries/botframework-connector/src/auth/connectorFactoryImpl.ts#L20) Adds Bot Framework / Bot Builder information which is used to track telemetry. 
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/assets/14900841/8c0dc2ae-51fe-4d55-9fc1-7009622bcfcd)

We are hoping to have the ability to add Teams AI information for SMBA to parse for telemetry. 

Since Teams AI is JavaScript first, we request this would be done in the JS SDK first with fast follow for C# and Python

issue.title: fix: [#2782] Migrate to MSAL from adal-node
issue.body:
Fixes #2782

## Description
This PR removes the deprecated `adal-node` dependency and all related code, in favor of using `@azure/msal-node`.
We have updated all internal code structure related to bot authentication when using ADAL to start using MSAL instead. These changes include a refactor to be more closely similar to DotNet's implementation.
Additionally, we took the opportunity to add the missing `x5c` (SNI) parameter value for Certificate authentication.

## Specific Changes
  - Removed `adal-node` references and dependencies.
  - `AppCredentials`
    - New `AuthenticatorResult` interface in favor of `adal.TokenResponse` to avoid future type breaking changes.
    - Improved way to cache the acquired token.
  - `CertificateAppCredentials`
    - Added `x5c` (SNI) parameter to be passed in to MSAL.
    - Delegate getting the token functionality to the new MSAL authentication class.
  - `ManagedIdentityAppCredentials`
    - Cleaned up unnecessary properties from the `refreshToken` result.
  - `MicrosoftAppCredentials`
    - Delegate getting the token functionality to the new MSAL authentication class.
  - `MsalAppCredentials`
    - Cleaned up unnecessary properties from the `refreshToken` result.
  - Updated multiple unit tests around `nock` mocks because of the new MSAL implementation behaves differently than ADAL.

## Testing
The following image shows the Skills' bots working after the changes, and how we tested using certificates with the new `x5c` parameter.
![image](https://github.com/southworks/botbuilder-js/assets/62260472/9287c2aa-0cbe-433f-9ad8-3004dca0b8a2)
![image](https://github.com/southworks/botbuilder-js/assets/62260472/486cf6b3-be1c-4d9f-8190-a648f1013c86)

comment.body:
> Is it feasible to employ an upgraded version of @azure/msal-node to accommodate Node.js 20?

Hi @XiaofuHuang, @azure/msal-node version 2.x is not compatible with node versions 14 and 16 which the SDK still supports.

labels.name: Area: Authentication
labels.description: The issue is related to authenticating users (SSO, OAuth, etc.)

labels.name: Size: M
labels.description: The issue is not very complex and it is well understood, it will take 1 to 3 days to complete

labels.name: Area: SDK

pull_request.title: fix: [#2782] Migrate to MSAL from adal-node
pull_request.body:
Fixes #2782

## Description
This PR removes the deprecated `adal-node` dependency and all related code, in favor of using `@azure/msal-node`.
We have updated all internal code structure related to bot authentication when using ADAL to start using MSAL instead. These changes include a refactor to be more closely similar to DotNet's implementation.
Additionally, we took the opportunity to add the missing `x5c` (SNI) parameter value for Certificate authentication.

## Specific Changes
  - Removed `adal-node` references and dependencies.
  - `AppCredentials`
    - New `AuthenticatorResult` interface in favor of `adal.TokenResponse` to avoid future type breaking changes.
    - Improved way to cache the acquired token.
  - `CertificateAppCredentials`
    - Added `x5c` (SNI) parameter to be passed in to MSAL.
    - Delegate getting the token functionality to the new MSAL authentication class.
  - `ManagedIdentityAppCredentials`
    - Cleaned up unnecessary properties from the `refreshToken` result.
  - `MicrosoftAppCredentials`
    - Delegate getting the token functionality to the new MSAL authentication class.
  - `MsalAppCredentials`
    - Cleaned up unnecessary properties from the `refreshToken` result.
  - Updated multiple unit tests around `nock` mocks because of the new MSAL implementation behaves differently than ADAL.

## Testing
The following image shows the Skills' bots working after the changes, and how we tested using certificates with the new `x5c` parameter.
![image](https://github.com/southworks/botbuilder-js/assets/62260472/9287c2aa-0cbe-433f-9ad8-3004dca0b8a2)
![image](https://github.com/southworks/botbuilder-js/assets/62260472/486cf6b3-be1c-4d9f-8190-a648f1013c86)

issue.title: Add Conversational language understanding recognizer to botbuider-ai

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: The issue has just been created and it has not been reviewed by the team.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: A request for new functionality or an enhancement to an existing one.

issue.body:
### Use this [query](https://github.com/Microsoft/botbuilder-js/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen++label%3Afeature-request+) to search for the most popular feature requests.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**


**Describe the solution you'd like**
A similar recognizer to the LuisRecognizer provided by (botbuilder-ai)[https://www.npmjs.com/package/botbuilder-ai]


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Calling the CLU API directly is an alternative we've considered but an out of the box solution like the LUIS recongizer would be much more straightforward 

**Additional context**

pull_request.title: fix: [#2782] Migrate to MSAL from adal-node
pull_request.body:
Fixes #2782

## Description
This PR removes the deprecated `adal-node` dependency and all related code, in favor of using `@azure/msal-node`.
We have updated all internal code structure related to bot authentication when using ADAL to start using MSAL instead. These changes include a refactor to be more closely similar to DotNet's implementation.
Additionally, we took the opportunity to add the missing `x5c` (SNI) parameter value for Certificate authentication.

## Specific Changes
  - Removed `adal-node` references and dependencies.
  - `AppCredentials`
    - New `AuthenticatorResult` interface in favor of `adal.TokenResponse` to avoid future type breaking changes.
    - Improved way to cache the acquired token.
  - `CertificateAppCredentials`
    - Added `x5c` (SNI) parameter to be passed in to MSAL.
    - Delegate getting the token functionality to the new MSAL authentication class.
  - `ManagedIdentityAppCredentials`
    - Cleaned up unnecessary properties from the `refreshToken` result.
  - `MicrosoftAppCredentials`
    - Delegate getting the token functionality to the new MSAL authentication class.
  - `MsalAppCredentials`
    - Cleaned up unnecessary properties from the `refreshToken` result.

## Testing
The following image shows the Skills' bots working after the changes, and how we tested using certificates with the new `x5c` parameter.
![image](https://github.com/southworks/botbuilder-js/assets/62260472/9287c2aa-0cbe-433f-9ad8-3004dca0b8a2)
![image](https://github.com/southworks/botbuilder-js/assets/62260472/486cf6b3-be1c-4d9f-8190-a648f1013c86)

issue.title: Please upgrade zod package

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: The issue has just been created and it has not been reviewed by the team.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: A request for new functionality or an enhancement to an existing one.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

The `zod` version (`1.11.17`) used across the project has a security vulnerability, which gets picked up by various scanners, e.g. https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-ZOD-5925617 and it is also over two years old.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Please upgrade to `v3.x` release line (first released some 2+ years ago).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

n/a

**Additional context**

Would it make sense to turn on Renovate (or change Dependabot config) for this project? There does not seem be a clearly visible dependency upgrade strategy in place.

comment.body:
+1 we are use the botkit to generate our application ,in recently trivy scan , we found the issue of Zod. 

actually zod already fix this, but bot builder did not fix this. please upgrade of Zod to 3.xx

issue.title: `ParameterizedBotFrameworkAuthentication` should use `connectorClientOptions`

labels.name: bug

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: The issue has just been created and it has not been reviewed by the team.

issue.body:
## Versions

[Latest](https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/blob/736979c95deaa8cc1c55709a34d4d15bc314a9f6/libraries/botframework-connector/src/auth/parameterizedBotFrameworkAuthentication.ts#L186)

## Describe the bug

`ParameterizedBotFrameworkAuthentication` should use `connectorClientOptions` to create `ConnectorFactory`.

## Expected behavior

`ParameterizedBotFrameworkAuthentication` uses `connectorClientOptions` to create `ConnectorFactory`.

pull_request.title: fix: [botframework-connector] Use HashSet instead of string array for endorsement
pull_request.body:
Fixes [#4454](https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/issues/4454)

## Description
This small PR just changes an argument type in the static _validate_ method of the _EndorsementsValidator_ class.

## Specific Changes
<!-- Please list the changes in a concise manner. -->

  - Before this change the _validate_ method was receiving an array for endorsements, now it now receives a HashSet and reduces the time comlexity when it tries to verify if a key(channelId) exists. 

## Testing
All unit tests passed
![endorsements_validator](https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/assets/45975927/358dd392-a27c-4f68-8ace-d57d5bc8f50f)

<!-- If you are adding a new feature to a library, you must include tests for your new code. -->
